divs: Sighting Details At 23:00 hours while we stood on outer sun deck ofour Air Force barracks observing the night sky looking for aircraft the diskshaped object appeared moving from south to north over Naha Air Base, Japan. Itlooked perfectly round, made no sound, had no lights and moved at an approx.speed of 75 to 100 miles-per-hour. With binoculars we observed it on a steadynorthward until it faded out of sight. The sighting lasted approx two minutes.We contacted our Control Tower about it and the operator said that they didntsee anyhting and after the operator checked with radar he said that they had nocontacts for over one hour. The object reflected city lights over the city ofNaha. We were sure trhat it wasnt any type of conventional aircraft.
Summary: Twice observed silvery disks over Okinawa, Japan i
trends: There have been no other sightings in Naha
This sighting has never been favorited.
